subject: Self Care
title: Lack of Recognition
description: A quick win: understand Lack of Recognition.

hook.text: He delivered the project on time, under budget. His manager said nothing. Silence spoke louder than any criticism.

buildup.text: The effort-reward imbalance model shows that high effort with low recognition creates chronic workplace stress.

discovery.text: Recognition isn't just praise. It includes fair pay, advancement opportunities, and simply being acknowledged.

twist.text: People don't quit jobs. They quit feeling invisible. Recognition costs nothing but prevents the most expensive turnover.

climax.text: If your work goes unrecognized despite communication, it's a systemic issue â€” not a sign you should work harder.

punchline.text: Invisible effort leads to invisible departure. Recognition matters.

quiz.question: What does the effort-reward imbalance model predict?
options: All effort should be rewarded equally
